page.title: 01N.Edenbridge & environs.
page.content: Situated 26 miles south of London, Edenbridge got its name from the river Eden, running through the southern end of the town. This mainly rural area is situated one and a half miles from the Kent/Surrey border and includes the Spitals Cross estate, Marlpit Hill and the villages of Pootings and Four Elms. The Spitals Cross estate situated on the Nothern side of Edenbridge was built in 1967/68 as a G.L.C. overflow and includes residential property and light industry. The village of Four Elms situated two and a half miles North-East of Edenbridge covers an area of 2600 acres, of mainly crops and grassland. Marlpitt Hill is in the North corner of the grid. It is mainly a residential area.
